Back at the New York embassy Max tells Booster and Beetle their punishment for taking all of the JLI funds, which Aquaman found floating in the ocean and gave back to Max, is that Blue and Gold are the new JLI maids. Their first asignment... Guy's room.
name: Lifeboat

description: Guy Gardner faces off Metamorpho.
name: Family Ties

description:
Five years after his "death," Mon-El awakens from his tomb, summoned by the Time Trapper, the entity responsible for his resurrection. Will he allow the Trapper to resume his stature as the Thirtieth Century's greatest villain, or will he call the Trapper's bluff?

With Tasmia, Shadow Lass, never truly recovering from the death of her love, Mon-El, the council of Talok VII decide to name her cousin, Shadow Kid, the new planet protector. Suddenly, Mon-El arrives to greet Tasmia in her home, much to her shock. Mon-El explains to Tasmia that a part of the Time Trapper is in his body, which is why he is not dead. The couple realize they need to visit Brainiac 5 to help Mon-El in his precarious situation. They reach Brainiac 5, and amidst his testing, the Time Trapper plucks Mon-El from there and places him somewhere else, so he can take control. Meanwhile, a probe robot prevents Brainiac 5 and Tasmia from following suit, but Tasmia makes short work of it. Time Trapper explains to Mon-El that he created the Legion of Super-Heroes inadvertently, and if the Time Trapper dies, time will be changed and Mon-El will not exist anymore, since he was founded in a pocket universe. Mon-El is willing to take that risk to destroy the Time Trapper and everything fades to white after he delivers the final blow.

1. Cover by Dave Cockrum and Eric Shanower.
  2. "...In Memory Yet Green..." written by Mike W. Barr, penciled by Curt Swan, inked by Mark Badger, colored by Tom McCraw and lettered by Todd Klein.
  3. "The Thorned Path The Origin of Val Armorr, Karate Kid!" scripted by Tom and Mary Bierbaum, penciled by Mike Parobeck, inked by Paul Fricke, colored by Tom McCraw and lettered by J. E. Workman.
  4. "The Unique Properties of Condo Arlik" written by Robert Loren Fleming, penciled by Chris Sprouse, inked by Al Gordon, colored by Tom McCraw and lettered by John Costanza.
  5. "Secrets Behind the Origins" A 1-1/2 column text piece on the histories of Karate Kid, Ferro Lad and Chemical King by unknown.

Note: Some characters have cameo appearances.
name: ...In Memory Yet Green... / The Thorned Path The Origin of Val Armorr, Karate Kid! / The Unique Properties of Condo Arlik

description: Part 3 of a four-part tale that crosses over with issues 17 and 18 of the Doc Savage comic in which the two great pulp magazine heroes, The Shadow and Doc Savage and their respective teams join together to battle evil doers. This issue features "The Big Boom," Part 3 of "The Conflagration Man."
name: "The Conflagration Man" Chapter 2 The Big Boom

description: New Brindon III has been overrun with a fatal disease that McCoy can't cure...so the government settles for executing the ill doctor.
name: Fast Friends

description: A rescue mission that's not what it appears on the surface reunites Geordi with an old lover. Part 1 of 2, continued next issue.
name: Serafin's Survivors

description: There's trouble at home that Starman would just as soon not face...but running from it sends him into even bigger trouble at the hands of a robotic assassin.
name: Heavy Artillery

description:
Learn the history of Ben Turner, as Sarge Steel tries to crack the Bronze Tiger. Plus, Jewelee learns something that changes her life.

First time Barbara Gordon is named as the Oracle.
name: Caging the Tiger

description:
The night before he and Lana Lang leave for their freshman term at Shuster University in Seigel Florida, Clark Kent saves his best friend Pete Ross one more time. They're at a bonfire at Lake Wylie State Park. Pete and a girl named Becky are arguing, and soon they are drag racing. Pete loses control of his car and almost goes over a cliff into the lake. Dropped off at home afterward, Clark gets some sage advice from Pa Kent.

The Kents see Clark and Lana off at the bus terminal and the two are on their way. Shuster University campus is a huge difference from Smallville, Kansas.

TJ White is dropped off by his father, who turns out to be Clark's idol.

As Clark, Lana and TJ get settled in, starnge things are happening in the research lab.
name: The Superboy

description:
Terror on the Street!" What is the Fear Factory? And what does it have to do with the recent turmoil in the lives of Superman and his pal, Jimmy Olsen?

Notes:

  • WGBS Flying Newsroom appears.
  • First post-Crisis appearances of Mokkari and Simyan.
  • Jack Kirby credited as inspiration.
  • Chronological continuation in Adventures of Superman #463.
name: Terror on the Streets
